pages:
STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
LANSING
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 25, 2021
Delora ONeill
Wellspring Lutheran Services Gaylord
1260 South Otsego Ave
Gaylord, MI 49735
RE: License #: CB690358779
Investigation #: 2021C0102013
Wellspring Lutheran Services Gaylord
Dear Ms. ONeill:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) and your contract.
01/2015 P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909-8150
www.michigan.gov  (517) 284-9740

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB690358779
Investigation #: 2021C0102013
Complaint Receipt Date: 03/15/2021
Investigation Initiation Date: 03/15/2021
Report Due Date: 05/14/2021
Licensee Name: Wellspring Lutheran Services
Licensee Address: 4100 Pier N. Blvd Ste. A
Flint, MI 48504-1487
Licensee Telephone #: (989) 262-7386
Administrator: Delora ONeill, Director
Licensee Designee: Sean De Four, Designee
Name of Facility: Wellspring Lutheran Services Gaylord
Facility Address: 1260 South Otsego Ave
Gaylord, MI 49735
Facility Telephone #: (989) 732-1040
Original Issuance Date: 07/16/2014
License Status: REGULAR
Effective Date: 01/16/2021
Expiration Date: 01/15/2023
Capacity: Unknown
Program Type: CHILD PLACING AGENCY, PRIVATE

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Agency failed to assess an adult household member's presence Yes
on Central Registry. In May 2020, a complaint was received
regarding an unknown male in the home and regarding a child
displaying sexualized behavior. While the youth's behavior was
addressed in a Special Evaluation, the presence of the adult male
never was. The agency knowingly allowed the adult male to
reside in the home despite receiving notification their name was
on Central Registry.
Additional Findings Yes
III. METHODOLOGY
03/15/2021 Special Investigation Intake
2021C0102013
03/15/2021 Special Investigation Initiated - Letter
email back and forth to referral source
03/15/2021 Contact - Face to Face
On-site to Wellspring's office reviewed Foster Parent A and B's
foster home file, spoke by telephone with Director 2 and Licensing
Worker 3. Staff 1 was the only one in the office due to COVID 19.
03/16/2021 Contact - Telephone call made
Call referral source for additional information
03/17/2021 Contact - Telephone call made
Interviewed by telephone Licensing Worker 6, Licensing
Supervisor 5 and Director 2
03/18/2021 Contact - Telephone call made
Interviewed by telephone Foster Care Worker 4
03/24/2021 Contact - Telephone call made
Interviewed by telephone Licensing Supervisor 5, Licensing
Worker 3, Director 2, Foster Care Worker 4, and Licensing
Worker 6
03/25/2021 Contact - Telephone call made
Interviewed by telephone Foster Care Worker 7

Exit Conference
The results of this special investigation was given by telephone to
ALLEGATION:
Agency failed to assess an adult household member's presence on Central Registry.
In May 2020, a complaint was received regarding an unknown male in the home and
regarding a child displaying sexualized behavior. While the youth's behavior was
addressed in a Special Evaluation, the presence of the adult male never was. The
agency knowingly allowed the adult male to reside in the home despite receiving
notification their name was on Central Registry.
INVESTIGATION:
Licensing Worker 3 was assigned a special evaluation on April 24, 2020 involving
Foster Parent A and Foster B’s foster home license. The anonymous allegation was
that Foster Child C was displaying sexualized behavior. In the Summary of
Allegations, it listed the members of the household and that included “An unknown
adult male also lives in the home”.
Licensing Worker 3 was interviewed by telephone on March 15, 2021. She said the
“unknown adult male” had passed away before the special evaluation.
Licensing Worker 3 was recontacted by telephone of March 17, 2021, she said that
Foster Parent B’s father (Adult D) was not in the foster home at the time of the
special evaluation that she did. She said because of COVID-19 she did not go to
Foster Parent A and Foster Parent B’s home, she conducted interviews over video
conferencing. Licensing Worker 3’s special evaluation was signed on June 10, 2020.
On May 14, 2020, during the timeframe in which the special evaluation was open
(April 24 to June 10), Licensing Worker 6 went to the foster home of Foster Parent A
and Foster Parent B and had Adult D fill out and sign a DCWL-1326 (Licensing
Clearance Record Request).
An email was received from Kelly Maltby, Manager, Disciplinary Action Unit, Division
of Child Welfare Licensing on March 15, 2021 which stated: “The agency was
notified on May 21, 2020, when (Adult D)’s clearances were uploaded into
MiSACWIS” (Michigan Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System).
The clearances showed that Adult D was on central registry.
Licensing Worker 3 had the following entry in her Special Evaluation Report dated
June 10, 2020:

5/22/2020: Worker followed up with (Foster Parent A) to see if she had any other
concerns. (Foster Parent A) said (Foster Child C) had a video visit with (her
sibling) yesterday and had not displayed any concerning behaviors since the
visit. She feels this is progress and is hopeful. Worker informed (Foster Parent A)
she and (Foster Parent B) were found to be in compliance with all foster care
rules and policies. Worker encouraged her to keep documenting”
Special Evaluation, 2020C0628852 does not address Adult D living in the foster
home. The agency is required to investigate Licensing Rules for Foster Family
Homes Rule 400.9202 Member of household qualifications.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in
the agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(a) Submit a special investigation record to the
department’s licensing authority within 5 working
days in the manner prescribed by the department.
(b) Initiate a special evaluation of the foster home as
soon as is indicated, based on the information
received, but not later than 7 calendar days after
receipt of the information.
(c) Conduct a thorough investigation including all
necessary collateral contacts.
ANALYSIS: Since “An unknown adult male also lives in the home” was in the
allegation section of CWL-4005 (Special Evaluation Report),
Adult D’s presence in the home should have been evaluated.
Additionally, a special evaluation by the agency is required of
Foster Parent A and Foster Parent B having Adult D as a
household member named on Central Registry.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Adult D’s DCWL-1326 (Licensing Clearance Record Request) was uploaded into
MiSACWIS on May 21, 2020, showing that he was named on central registry.

INVESTIGATION:
As stated above, Adult D’s DCWL-1326 was filled out with the help of Licensing
Worker 6 on May 14, 2020. The results were available to the agency in MiSACWIS
on May 21, 2020. The result on the DCWL-1326 showed that Adult D was named on
central registry.
Licensing Worker 6 when interviewed on March 17, 2021 said the clearance form
came back “fine”. She said that special evaluations of foster homes in her agency
are assigned by Licensing Supervisor 5 and licensing workers are generally not
assigned to do special evaluations of the foster homes they license.
An email was received from Kelly Maltby, Manager, Compliance and Regulatory
Action Unit, Division of Child Welfare Licensing on March 15, 2021 which stated:
“The agency was notified on May 21, 2020, when (Adult D)’s clearances were
uploaded into MiSACWIS.”
The foster home reevaluation dated November 18, 2020 stated the following:
(Adult D) is (Foster Parent B)’s father. At the time of individual interviews
(Foster Parent A and Foster Parent B) reported to worker (Adult D)’s health
was not good. They shared Hospice care was beginning and he was declining
fast. Worker completed his interview on 10/28/2020. (Adult D) reported very
little to this worker as his speak was limited and he was not able to
understand this in workers questions. (Adult D) shared he had been living
with (Foster Parent A and Foster Parent B) for three to four weeks, and that
there are a lot of people in the home and its overwhelming. Worker spoke
with (Foster Parent A and Foster Parent B) after this interview; (Adult D) had
been living with them for most of the year. (Foster Parent A and Foster Parent
B) reported his mental capacity is very low. Sadly, on 11/11/2020, (Adult D)
passed. Worker has since spoke with (Foster Parent A), she reports everyone
is doing well. (Foster Child C and Foster Child E) are taking it the hardest and
are often found looking into his bedroom. (Foster Parent A) reports funeral
arrangements will be this weekend (11/14/2020).
Foster Care Worker 7 was interviewed by telephone on March 17, 2021. She said
she was in the foster home of Foster Parent A and Foster Parent B every month
including June, July, August, September, October, and November 2020. She said
she saw Adult D in the home on October 23, 2020. She said that Adult D was in very
poor health and hospice was involved.
Foster Care Worker 4 was interviewed by telephone of March 18, 2021. She said
was in the home of Foster Parent A and Foster Parent B on the following dates:
June 23, 2020
July 17, 2020
August 24, 2020

September 21, 2020
October 23, 2020
Foster Care Worker 4 said she first learned of Adult D being in the foster home when
she got Foster Child E’s case in June of 2020. She said she was told by Foster
Parent A and the “licensing team” in June or July of 2020.
Adult D, who was named on central registry, lived in the foster home of Foster
Parent A and Foster Parent B from May 14, 2020 to November 11, 2020 when he
died.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12206 Staff qualifications
(1) An agency shall require a staff member who has
ongoing contact with children or parents to be a person
who has the ability, experience, education, and training
to perform the duties assigned.
ANALYSIS: Based on the interviews, Licensing Worker 6, Foster Care
Worker 4, and Foster Care Worker 7 knew of Adult D’s
presence in the foster home of Foster Parent A and Foster
Parent B and did not conduct an assessment of his
appropriateness in the home as a household member, and did
not check the results of the 1326 sent in on him. Therefore, the
agency knew or should have known that Adult D was on central
registry and could not be in a licensed foster home.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
The Special Evaluation Report had a signature date of June 10, 2020 (47 days).
INVESTIGATION:
In reviewing the Special Evaluation, 2020C0628852, the intake date was April 24,
2020 to the signature date was June 10, 2020. There was not a letter for an
extension beyond 45 days in MiSACWIS.

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(3) An agency shall complete a special evaluation within 45
calendar days after receipt of the information. If additional
time is required, then the agency shall inform the foster
parent, in writing, of the basis for the extension and the
expected length of the extension. The total time for the
completion of the investigation shall not exceed 90
calendar days without written approval from the chief
administrator or his or her designee.
ANALYSIS: The special evaluation was not completed in the required 45
days and there was not an extension letter to the foster parents
in MiSACWIS.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Adult D lived in a licensed foster home from May 14, 2020 to November 11, 2020 in
violation of Public Act 116 of 1973 (Michigan Law).
Licensing Worker 3 was interviewed by telephone on March 24, 2021 she said she
did not know Adult D was named on central registry until a staff meeting a few days
ago when it was brought up. Licensing Worker 3 said no one in her agency knew
Adult D was named on central registry until it was brought up in staff meeting a few
days ago.
Licensing Supervisor 5 was also interviewed by telephone on March 24, 2021. She
said she did not know that Adult D was named on central registry until the agency
receive a notice from Division of Child Welfare Licensing (DCWL) on March 17,
2021. Licensing Supervisor 5 said Licensing Worker 6 sent the clearance to DCWL
on May 18, 2020 and then followed up with a second email on October 1, 2020.
Licensing Worker 5 said the notice received on March 17, 2021 included instructions
to open a special evaluation on the foster home license. She said they had opened
the special evaluation.
Director 2 was contacted by telephone on March 24, 2021. When asked when she
knew that Adult D was on central registry, she said she did not know and she was
finding out from me for the first time.
Licensing Worker 6 was contacted by telephone on March 24, 2021. She said she
found out that Adult D was named on central registry when she received an email
from Kristen Frazer, of DCWL on March 18, 2021. Attached to that email was a letter

dated March 17, 2021 from Rachel Willis, DCWL Director that told the agency that
Adult D was on central registry and they were required to do a special evaluation of
the foster home.
Foster Care Worker 4 was contacted by telephone on March 24, 2021. When she
was asked when she learned that Adult D was on central registry, she said “this is
the first I am hearing about this.”
Foster Care Worker 7 was contacted by telephone on March 25, 2021. She was
asked when she learned of Adult D being on central registry, she said “I am just
learning this now.”
APPLICABLE LAW
722.115q Child care center, group child care home, or family child care
home; contact with child by licensee, child care staff member,
or household adult member prohibited; conditions.
(1) Except as provided in section 5n(8), a licensee, child care
staff member, or adult member of the household may not have
contact with a child who is in the care of a child care center,
group child care home, or family child care home, until the
department obtains documentation from the department of
health and human services that he or she has not been named
in a central registry case as the perpetrator of child abuse or
child neglect. Upon request by the department, the licensee,
child care staff member, or adult member of the household
shall provide the department with an updated authorization
for a central registry clearance. If a central registry clearance
documents that a licensee, child care staff member, or adult
member of the household is named in a central registry case
as a perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect, he or she is
ineligible to receive a license to operate a child care center,
group child care home, or family child care home, be an adult
member of the household, or be a child care staff member.
ANALYSIS: Based on the interviews, Licensing Worker 6, Foster Care Worker
4, and Foster Care Worker 7 knew Adult D lived in the foster home
of Foster Parent A and Foster Parent B. The agency submitted a
DCWL-1326 on May 14, 2020 and the result were uploaded in
MiSACWIS on May 21, 2020. Therefore, the agency knew or
should have known that Adult D was on central registry and could
not be in a licensed home.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended upon the receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, there be
no change to the licensing status of this private child placing agency. A special
evaluation of the foster home as cited above is required, and that needs to be part of
the corrective action plan.
March 25, 2021
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
March 25, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
